greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A(n,k) is (1/k) times the number of n-member subsets of [k*n] whose elements sum to a multiple of n; square array A(n,k), n>=1, k>=1, read by antidiagonals.
comment: For k > 1 also (1/(k-1)) times the number of n-member subsets of [k*n-1] whose elements sum to a multiple of n.
The sequence of row n satisfies a linear recurrence with constant coefficients of order n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..150, flattened
mathematica: A[n_, k_] := 1/(n k) Sum[Binomial[k d, d] (-1)^(n+d) EulerPhi[n/d], {d, Divisors[n]}];
Table[A[n-k+1, k], {n, 1, 12}, {k, n, 1, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 04 2019 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 14 2019
